Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the tribunal erred in finding Mrs. Khan had a right to citizenship in Guyana and failed to conduct a proper section 97 analysis for Mr. Khan
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Tribunal assumed Mrs. Khan’s citizenship rights without sufficient evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Legal provisions, marital status documentation, discretionary citizenship laws
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Well-founded fear of persecution and lack of alternative protection in Guyana
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Objective basis for fear of persecution and availability of state protection
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Assumption of automatic citizenship acquisition and omission of section 97 risk analysis
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to assess whether Mrs. Khan actually possessed or could obtain Guyanese citizenship and failure to analyze non-section 96 risks for Mr. Khan
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Discretionary nature of Guyanese citizenship by marriage
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Requirement to demonstrate well-founded fear in all countries of citizenship or potential citizenship
Crimes.Application_Factor: Potential access to protection in Guyana due to alleged citizenship
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Denial of refugee claim based on assumed alternative protection
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Error in law regarding citizenship assumption and omission of section 97 analysis
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remitted for reconsideration by a differently constituted tribunal
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived alternative protection options in Guyana
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of evidence supporting automatic acquisition of Guyanese citizenship
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Failure to conduct independent risk assessment under section 97
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Assumption of citizenship without verifying legal entitlement
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to tribunal’s legal interpretation and factual assumptions
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Omission of mandatory statutory analysis under section 97
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to conduct required section 97 analysis

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the tribunal erred in finding Mrs. Khan had citizenship rights in Guyana and whether it adequately analyzed Mr. Khan's need for protection under section 97
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Questionable credibility due to use of false passport and failure to claim asylum in the U.S.
Crimes.Evidence_Type: False U.S. entry document, marital status, criminal incidents in Guyana
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to criminal acts and discrimination in Guyana
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Subjective and objective basis for fear of persecution
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Use of false documents and lack of prior asylum claim affecting credibility
Crimes.Application_Error: Assumed ease of acquiring Guyanese citizenship and failed to analyze non-persecution risks under section 97
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Nature of document fraud and its impact on admissibility and credibility
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Need to establish well-founded fear in all relevant countries
Crimes.Application_Factor: Prior use of fraudulent travel document and absence of U.S. refugee claim
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Denial of refugee claim based on perceived alternative citizenship and lack of state protection analysis
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Error in assessing citizenship acquisition and failure to apply section 97 independently
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remitted for reconsideration by a differently constituted tribunal
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived alternative citizenship and lack of state protection analysis
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance on unverified claims of citizenship despite use of false documents
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Failure to properly assess credibility and document fraud implications
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Use of false passport to enter the United States
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Lack of subjective fear due to no prior refugee claim; use of fraudulent documents
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to tribunal’s findings on citizenship and protection needs
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Inadequate analysis of section 97 risks and credibility concerns
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to conduct proper section 97 analysis
